intro: Crotalaria tinctoria, commonly known as the Indian clockplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow and purple flowers that resemble clock faces, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae and is known for its erect, branching stems and pinnately compound leaves. It produces pods that contain seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of dye. Crotalaria tinctoria is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions.
